text: Job’s Fourth Speech
Then\f + \fr 12:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Job answered and said,
“Truly indeed you\f + \fr 12:2 \ft Plural \f* \add are the\add* people,
and wisdom will die with you.\f + \fr 12:2 \ft Plural \f*
⸤I also have insight⸥\f + \fr 12:3 \ft Literally “Also for me heart” \f* like you;\f + \fr 12:3 \ft Plural \f*
I am not more inferior than you.\f + \fr 12:3 \ft Plural \f*
And ⸤who does not know things like these⸥?\f + \fr 12:3 \ft Literally “and who there is not like these” \f*
I am a laughingstock to my friends:\f + \fr 12:4 \ft Hebrew “to his friends” \f*
‘\add He\add* calls on God, and he answers him.’
A righteous, blameless man \add is\add* a laughingstock.

⸤Those at ease have contempt⸥\f + \fr 12:5 \ft Literally “Contempt \fq is \ft according to the thought of \fq the \ft complacent” \f* for \add the\add* thought of ⸤disaster⸥,\f + \fr 12:5 \ft Literally “a torch” \f*
\add but it is\add* ready for those unstable of foot.
\add The\add* tents of \add the\add* destroyers are at peace,
and \add there is\add* security for those who provoke God,
\add for those\add* whom God brings into his hand.\f + \fr 12:6 \ft Or “power” \f*
“But\f + \fr 12:7 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* ask\f + \fr 12:7 \ft Or “ask now,” or “please ask” \f* \add the\add* animals, and they will teach you,
and the birds of the heaven, and they will tell you;
or ask the earth, and it will teach you,
and the fishes of the sea will declare to you.
Who among all of these does not know
that Yahweh’s hand has done this?
In whose hand \add is\add* the life of all living things
and ⸤the breath of every human being⸥?\f + \fr 12:10 \ft Literally “the breath of all the flesh of man” \f*
Does not \add the\add* ear test words
and \add the\add* palate taste food for itself?
Wisdom \add is\add* with \add the\add* aged,
and understanding \add is in\add* length of days.
“With him \add are\add* wisdom and powerful deeds,
and to him \add belong\add* counsel and understanding.
If he tears down, then\f + \fr 12:14 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* it will not be rebuilt;
if he shuts a man in, then\f + \fr 12:14 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he cannot be freed.
Look, \add if\add* he withholds the water,\f + \fr 12:15 \ft Or “waters” \f* then\f + \fr 12:15 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* they dry up;
and \add if\add* he sends them out, then\f + \fr 12:15 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* they overwhelm \add the\add* land.
“Strength and sound wisdom \add are\add* with him;
\add the\add* deceived and \add the\add* deceiver \add are\add* his.\f + \fr 12:16 \ft Or “for him” \f*
He leads counselors away stripped,
and he makes fools of judges.
He loosens \add the\add* fetters of kings,
and he binds a loincloth on their loins.
He leads priests away stripped,
and he overthrows ⸤the members of ancient families⸥.\f + \fr 12:19 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft constant” \f*
He deprives \add the\add* trustworthy of speech,
and he takes away \add the\add* discretion of elders.
He pours contempt on noblemen,
and he loosens \add the\add* girdle of \add the\add* mighty.
“He uncovers mysteries out of darkness,
and he brings deep shadow to the light.
He makes the nations great, then\f + \fr 12:23 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he destroys them;
he expands the nations, then\f + \fr 12:23 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he guides them.
He strips \add away\add* the insight of the heads of the earth’s people,
and he makes them wander in ⸤a pathless wasteland⸥.\f + \fr 12:24 \ft Literally “in a wasteland not a way” \f*
They grope \add in\add* the dark ⸤without⸥\f + \fr 12:25 \ft Literally “and not” \f* light,
and he makes them stagger like a\f + \fr 12:25 \ft Hebrew “the” \f* drunkard.
